place.name: THRUMPTON
place.gazetteerText: THRUMPTON, a parish in Basford district, Notts: on the river Trent, 2 miles SSE of Long Eaton r. station, and 7 SW of Nottingham. Post town, Kegworth, under Derby. Acres, 1,080. Real property, £1,709. Pop., 144. Houses, 35. T. Hall is the seat of the Hon. G. A. Byron. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £77. Patron, the Hon. G. A. Byron. The church is old. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
